title: Convert the Flow Rate from $$\frac{L}{min}$$ to $$\frac{{cm}^3}{s}$$
text: Calculate the flow rate of blood in $$\frac{{cm}^3}{s}$$ using the fact that $$1$$ L $$=$$ $$1000$$ $${cm}^3$$ and $$1min=60s$$.

title: Flow Rate Formula
text: Use the formula for volume flow rate: $$Q=A v$$ where Q is the volume flow rate, A is the cross-sectional area, and v is the speed of the flow.

title: Calculate the Cross-Sectional Area
text: The radius of the aorta, $$r$$, is $$1.0$$ cm. The cross-sectional area A is given by: A $$=$$ $${pir}^2=$$? in $${cm}^2$$

title: Calculate the Speed of Blood
text: Using the formula Q $$=$$ A × v, solve for v: $$v=\frac{Q}{A}=\frac{83.33}{3.14}=$$? in $$\frac{cm}{s}$$ (round to the nearst integer)
